Job Description

Key Tasks and Responsibilities:


Develop the Project Procurement & Subcontract Plan
Develop Bidders List for each type of work to be subcontracted
Pre-qualification of new Subcontractors and Vendors
Liaise with Contracts Manager for preparation of flow-downs / special conditions from Prime Contract to be applied to key Packages
Ensure the scope of work and other requirements pertinent to a specific work package is clearly defined (e.g. payment milestones, deliverables, progress reporting, etc.)
Responsible for preparing Request for Proposal and negotiating Terms and Conditions, in line with policies and procedures
Conduct the commercial evaluation of proposals and make recommendation for award, after technical evaluation is completed
Negotiate cost reductions and savings
Carry out bid clarification and pre-award meetings as required
Clearly understand the interfaces between McDermott and the Vendors/Subcontractors, and ensure that the responsibilities are clearly addressed in the Subcontract/Purchase Order documents
Prepare Recommendations for Award for review and signature of Management Team.
Chair kick-off meetings with key Vendors & Subcontractors
Facilitate pre-production meetings, ensuring minutes are recorded and distributed in a timely manner
Maintain Project Procurement & Subcontract Plan updated and carry out progress weekly meetings with key project stakeholders to monitor dates & address delays, concerns, etc.
Have in place all necessary logs to track the order progress such as Qualification Log, Technical Query (TQ) log, Concession/Deviation Requests log, Change Order log, invoice log, etc. (as applicable)
Address disputes, claims and performance issues
Monitor budget and manage changes to the Order through proper Change Order process;
Ensure Subcontract deliverables (schedules, procedures, progress reports, etc.) are received in a timely manner
Attend internal project meetings or Client meetings, as required
Ensure that contractual requirements are met by Subcontractor and required bank/parent company guarantees, insurance certificates, etc. are received in a timely manner
Provide input to project weekly and monthly progress reports for internal and/or external distribution as per internal and Contract requirements
Liaise with Project Team to address any Vendor/Subcontractor performance issue
Manage the invoice and payment process
Monitor Subcontractor’s deliveries and engage Logistics for shipment/import/export activities;
Manage commercial closeout of Purchase Orders and Subcontract Agreements (Issue Completion Certificates, monitor bank guarantees and bonds, warranty, etc)
Ensure all documents are duly filed in the proper project folders and Sharepoint sites as applicable


Essential Qualifications and Education:


Ability to accomplish established objectives within a diverse corporate environment
Knowledge of sourcing and contracting strategies, principles and procedures
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Ability to communicate effectively in writing and orally in a business environment;
Effective problem solver
Good decision-maker
Effective negotiator
Proficient in the use of MS Office computer applications including Word, Excel, Access and Power Point
A minimum of 7 years’ experience in Procurement and Subcontract activities, directly for the Oil & Gas industry (subsea & offshore construction
Business Degree in a related field


Company Overview and Core Values:

McDermott is a premier, fully-integrated provider of technology, engineering and construction solutions to the energy industry. For more than a century, customers have trusted McDermott to design and build end-to-end infrastructure and technology solutions—from the wellhead to the storage tank—to transport and transform oil and gas into the products the world needs today.

At McDermott, we hold all employees accountable to follow our 5 core values.

Integrity – we maintain a firm adherence to legal and ethical conduct
One Team – we are one company, where everyone is equally important
Go Beyond – we seek courageous and creative solutions
Well-Being – we promote all forms of well-being
Commitment – we are reliable and dependable in delivering quality solution


About Us

At McDermott, we proudly work together to create and deliver innovative engineering and construction solutions for the energy industry. Our customers trust our technology-driven approach to design and build infrastructure solutions to responsibly transport and transform natural resources into the products the world needs today. Because we’re powered by the most innovative minds, we rise to every challenge to make what was once just an idea a reality.
